queries.query_name: Pod Security Policy Admission Control Plugin Not Set
queries.description: When using kube-apiserver command, the '--enable-admission-plugins' flag should have 'PodSecurityPolicy' plugin and the plugin should be correctly configured in AdmissionControl Config file
Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kubernetes-controller-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-controller-manager}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{ltsp-token-create}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeadm}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{ltsp}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{http}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{ltsp}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{config}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{kubernetes-scheduler}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-scheduler}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{kubernetes-etcd}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{etcd}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{ltsp-publish}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeadm}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{ltsp}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{tftp}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{kubernetes-kubeadm-tasks}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeadm}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{kubernetes-apiserver}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-apiserver}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{kubernetes-admin}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{admin}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{ltsp-token-update}}.spec.jobTemplate.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeadm}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{kubernetes-kubeadm-tasks}}.spec.jobTemplate.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeadm}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with wildcard RBAC permissions provide excessive rights to the Kubernetes API and should be avoided. The principle of least privilege recommends to specify only the set of needed objects and actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{ltsp-publisher}}.rules[0].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{ltsp-publisher}}.rules[0].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kubernetes-apiserver}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-apiserver}}.volumeMounts.name={{apiserver-config}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{kubernetes-etcd}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{etcd}}.volumeMounts.name={{etcd-data}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{ltsp}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{config}}.volumeMounts.name={{config}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true

queries.query_name: Always Pull Images Admission Control Plugin Not Set
queries.description: When using kube-apiserver command, the '--enable-admission-plugins' flag should have 'AlwaysPullImages' plugin and the plugin should be correctly configured in AdmissionControl Config file
When using kube-apiserver command, the 'audit-log-path' flag should be defined
When using kube-apiserver command, the '--audit-policy-file' flag should be defined
Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kubernetes-etcd}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{etcd}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{ltsp}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{tftp}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

metadata.name={{kubernetes-kubeadm-tasks}}.spec.jobTemplate.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeadm}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.

queries.query_name: Encryption Provider Config Is Not Defined
queries.description: When using kube-apiserver commands, the '--encryption-provider-config' flag should be defined and the encryption should be correctly configured in Encryption Configuration file
When using kube-apiserver command, the 'kubelet-certificate-authority' flag should be set
Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{ltsp-token-generator}}.rules[1] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{ltsp-token-generator}}.rules[1] is granted read access (verbs: get, patch) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.query_name: Security Context Deny Admission Control Plugin Not Set
queries.description: When using kube-apiserver command, the '--enable-admission-plugins' flag should have 'SecurityContextDeny' plugin and the plugin should be correctly configured in AdmissionControl Config file when 'PodSecurityPolicy' plugin is not set

files.expected_value: --enable-admission-plugins flag should contain 'SecurityContextDeny' plugin if 'PodSecurityPolicy' plugin should not be set

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary

metadata.name={{ltsp-publish}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{ltsp}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

queries.query_name: Audit Log Maxage Not Properly Set
queries.description: When using kube-apiserver command, the '--audit-log-maxage' flag should be defined and set to 30 or more days

queries.query_name: Audit Log Maxbackup Not Properly Set

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
Cronjobs must have a configured deadline, which means the attribute 'startingDeadlineSeconds' must be defined
Deployments should be assigned with a PodDisruptionBudget to ensure high availability

files.actual_value: metadata.name=kubernetes-controller-manager is not targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget

files.expected_value: metadata.name=kubernetes-scheduler is targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget
files.actual_value: metadata.name=kubernetes-scheduler is not targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget

files.expected_value: metadata.name=kubernetes-apiserver is targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget
files.actual_value: metadata.name=kubernetes-apiserver is not targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget

queries.query_name: Object Is Using A Deprecated API Version
queries.description: Kubernetes APIs evolve over time and are sometimes removed with newer releases. To prevent incompatibilities when upgrading Kubernetes, deprecated APIs should be replaced with newer and more stable API versions.
